name: resiexd
params: class c0, class c1, wff w0

stmt.origin: sylancr(w0, wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe), wfun(cid), wcel(c0, c1))
stmt.pretty: sylancr(w0, (= |` c0)∈ 𝕌, Fun(=), c0 ∈ c1)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))
-| wfun(cid)
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wa(wfun(cid), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))
-| wfun(cid)
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wa(wfun(cid), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))

|- wi(w0, wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))
-| wi(wa(wfun(cid), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wfun(cid), wcel(c0, c1)), wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wcel(cres(cid, c0), universe))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, c1))

comment: The restriction of the identity relation to a set is a set. (Contributed by AV, 15-Feb-2020.)
